title: Frank Stephens (rugby)
text:
Frank Stephens (23 March 1899 – 11 March 1971) was an English-born Welsh <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> and professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1920s and 1930s. He played invitational level rugby union (RU) for <a href="Crawshays%20RFC">Crawshays RFC</a>, and at club level for <a href="Bargoed%20RFC">Bargoed RFC</a> and <a href="Cardiff%20RFC">Cardiff RFC</a>, and representative level rugby league (RL) for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Wales</a> and <a href="Other%20Nationalities%20rugby%20league%20team">Other Nationalities</a>, and at club level for <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a>, <a href="Batley%20Bulldogs">Batley</a> and <a href="Rochdale%20Hornets">Rochdale Hornets</a>, as a , or , i.e. number 8 or 10, or, 11 or 12, during the era of contested <a href="Scrum%20%28rugby%29%23Rugby%20league">scrum</a>s. Frank Stephens played for Wigan against Dewsbury in the first rugby league <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final to be held at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium%20%281923%29">Wembley Stadium</a>, <a href="London">London</a> in 1929.
Biography.
Frank Stephens was born in <a href="Drybrook">Drybrook</a>, Gloucestershire but brought up in <a href="Blackwood%2C%20Caerphilly">Blackwood</a>, <a href="Monmouthshire">Monmouthshire</a>. Prior to his Wigan rugby league career he had played rugby union for <a href="Bargoed%20RFC">Bargoed</a>, and subsequently joined <a href="Cardiff%20RFC">Cardiff RFC</a> in 1923. During this period he also played for <a href="Crawshays%20RFC">Captain Crawshay's Welsh XV</a> select tours from 1922 to 1925. His rugby league career started when invited to sign for <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan RFC</a> in 1925.
Playing career.
International honours.
Frank Stephens won a <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a> for <a href="Other%20Nationalities%20rugby%20league%20team">Other Nationalities</a> (RL) while at Wigan in the 20-27 defeat by England at <a href="Headingley%20Stadium%23Rugby%20ground">Headingley</a> <a href="Headingley%20Rugby%20Stadium">Rugby Stadium</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> on Wednesday 20 March 1929, and won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Wales</a> (RL) while at Wigan in the 34-8 victory over New Zealand at <a href="Taff%20Vale%20Park">Taff Vale Park</a>, <a href="Pontypridd">Pontypridd</a> on Saturday 4 December 1926, the 12-20 defeat by England at <a href="Central%20Park%20%28Wigan%29">Central Park</a>, <a href="Wigan">Wigan</a> on Wednesday 11 January 1928, the 15-39 defeat by England at <a href="White%20City%20Stadium%2C%20Cardiff">White City Stadium</a>, Sloper Road, <a href="Grangetown%2C%20Cardiff">Grangetown, Cardiff</a> on Wednesday 14 November 1928, and the 10-26 defeat by Australia at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium%20%281923%29">Wembley Stadium</a>, <a href="London">London</a> on Saturday 18 January 1930.
County honours.
Frank Stephens played in <a href="Monmouthshire%20rugby%20league%20team">Monmouthshire</a>'s 14-18 defeat by <a href="Glamorgan%20rugby%20league%20team">Glamorgan</a> in the non-<a href="County%20Championship%20%28rugby%20league%29">County Championship</a> match during the <a href="1926%E2%80%9327%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1926–27 season</a> at <a href="Taff%20Vale%20Park">Taff Vale Park</a>, <a href="Pontypridd">Pontypridd</a> on Saturday 30 April 1927, and represented <a href="Glamorgan%20and%20Monmouthshire%20rugby%20league%20team">Glamorgan and Monmouthshire</a> (RL) while at Wigan against <a href="Lancashire%20rugby%20league%20team">Lancashire</a> at <a href="Taff%20Vale%20Park">Taff Vale Park</a>, <a href="Pontypridd">Pontypridd</a> on Saturday 12 November 1927, against <a href="Cumberland%20rugby%20league%20team">Cumberland</a> at <a href="Recreation%20Ground%20%28Whitehaven%29">Recreation Ground?</a>, <a href="Whitehaven">Whitehaven</a> on Saturday 20 October 1928, against <a href="Cumberland%20rugby%20league%20team">Cumberland</a> at <a href="Welsh%20White%20City%20Stadium">Welsh White City Stadium</a>, Sloper Road, <a href="Grangetown%2C%20Cardiff">Grangetown, Cardiff</a> on Saturday 21 December 1929, and against <a href="Yorkshire%20rugby%20league%20team">Yorkshire</a> at <a href="Parkside%2C%20Hunslet">Parkside, Hunslet</a> on Thursday 27 February 1930.
Championship Final appearances.
Frank Stephens played right-, i.e. number 12, in <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a>'s 22-10 victory over <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a> in the <a href="Rugby%20Football%20League%20Championship">Championship</a> Final during the <a href="1925%E2%80%9326%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1925–26 season</a> at <a href="Knowsley%20Road">Knowsley Road</a>, <a href="St%20Helens%2C%20Merseyside">St. Helens</a> on Saturday 8 May 1926.
County League appearances.
Frank Stephens played in <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a>'s victory in the <a href="RFL%20Lancashire%20League">Lancashire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20leagues">County League</a> during the <a href="1925%E2%80%9326%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1925–26 season</a>.
Challenge Cup Final appearances.
Frank Stephens played left-, i.e. number 11, in <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a>'s 13-2 victory over <a href="Dewsbury%20Rams">Dewsbury</a> in the <a href="1928%E2%80%9329%20Challenge%20Cup">1928–29</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1928%E2%80%9329%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season%23Challenge%20Cup">1928–29 season</a> at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium%20%281923%29">Wembley Stadium</a>, <a href="London">London</a> on Saturday 4 May 1929.
County Cup Final appearances.
Frank Stephens played right-, i.e. number 12, in <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a>'s 11-15 defeat by <a href="Swinton%20Lions">Swinton</a> in the <a href="1925%E2%80%9326%20Lancashire%20Cup">1925–26</a> <a href="RFL%20Lancashire%20Cup">Lancashire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1925%E2%80%9326%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1925–26 season</a> at <a href="The%20Cliff%20%28training%20ground%29">The Cliff</a>, <a href="Broughton%2C%20Salford">Broughton</a> on Wednesday 9 December 1925, and played right- in the 5-4 victory over <a href="Widnes%20Vikings">Widnes</a> in the <a href="1928%E2%80%9329%20Lancashire%20Cup">1928–29</a> <a href="RFL%20Lancashire%20Cup">Lancashire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1928%E2%80%9329%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1928–29 season</a> at <a href="The%20Willows%2C%20Salford">The Willows, Salford</a> on Saturday 24 November 1928,
Genealogical information.
Frank Stephens' marriage to Edna (<a href="Given%20name%23Name%20at%20birth">née</a> Morris) was registered during first ¼ 1928 in <a href="Wigan">Wigan</a> district. They had children; Enid L. Stephens (<a href="http%3A//www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl%3Fcite%3DvF1ufWHszm9EtRGmuKkgUg%26amp%3Bscan%3D1">birth registered</a> during second ¼ 1928 in <a href="Wigan">Wigan</a> district), Ronald A. Stephens (<a href="http%3A//www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl%3Fcite%3D8M3%252F3jB4U%252Bn3jgQZNhYMTg%26amp%3Bscan%3D1">birth registered</a> during third ¼ 1929 in <a href="Wigan">Wigan</a> district), and Marjorie Stephens (<a href="http%3A//www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl%3Fcite%3D9dog6nH4OL9QFztxYmFR9w%26amp%3Bscan%3D1">birth registered</a> during first ¼ 1932 in <a href="Wigan">Wigan</a> district).
